text: Good food, slow service.  I'm pleasantly surprised by the quality of food here since most hotel restaurants are typically sub par.  The menu offer a wide variety of dishes and the food is delicious.  There are plenty of seating in this restaurant - bar, lounge, or table.  You can pick your own table but the arrival time of a waiter/waitress is up to chance.  Char Siu $22 - I enjoyed this pork belly and duck confit dish. It comes with mashed potatoes and maple butter glaze which produced a nice sweet and savory combination.  It also comes with pita and hummus, which makes a nice appetizer.  Artisan Beet Salad $15 - Delicious salad and not dominated by beets.  The yogurt dressing is very good and not overly sweet.  Diamond Lil's Star cocktail $12 - This coconut rum + lychee liqueur + lychee juice + lemon juice is delicious and not too sweet nor strong. Probably the best offering at the hotel.  Very nice space , good place to gather after  meetings and they keep it from feeling like a hotel restaurant.   Food seemed to be prepared with pride and staff was attentive.   Try the hummus.
The only thing that had any taste to it was the beer. Overpriced to eat boiled tasteless food. Not impressive when you're hangry.

Terrible experience. Super slow and forgetful staff. Rude management. Extremely overpriced drinks ($7.5 for a shot of Baileys. According to management "liquor is harder to make" so they HAVE to charge more) and the food was not only expensive but very poor. Overall bad experience.

Service was great. Food came out very fast. Decor is comfortable and modern. I ordered the Thai shrimp. It came with some of the best homemade hummus. It did not have cauliflower which I was excited about but the asparagus and broccoli was cooked perfectly and everything was well seasoned. Will definitely continue to eat there during my stays in Toronto.
